High priority in survey

```{r scenario-anb-priorities-species-high}
#| results: "asis"

make_list_species_display <- function(.species){
  .species_tmp <- .species |> 
  dplyr::arrange(kingdom |> dplyr::desc(), vern_name_nld) |>
  dplyr::mutate(vern_name_nld_col = kableExtra::cell_spec(
    x = vern_name_nld,
    color = dplyr::case_when(
      grepl("plant", kingdom) ~ col_plants,
      grepl("dier", kingdom) ~ col_animals
    )
  )) |>
  dplyr::select(vern_name_nld_col, kingdom) |>
  dplyr::mutate(id = dplyr::row_number(), .by = kingdom) |>
  tidyr::pivot_wider(
    id_cols = id,
    names_from = kingdom, values_from = vern_name_nld_col, 
    values_fill = NA
    ) |>
  dplyr::select(-id)
.species_tmp |> 
  knitr::kable(
    format = "html",
    escape = FALSE,
    col.names = c("plant", "animal"),
    table.attr = 'data-quarto-disable-processing="true"'
  ) |> kableExtra::kable_styling(
      bootstrap_options = c("condensed", "hover"), 
      full_width = FALSE,
      position = "left",
      font_size = .font_size
    ) |>
  kableExtra::row_spec(
    row = .species_tmp |> nrow() |> seq_len(),
    extra_css = "border-bottom: 0px"
  )
}

species_anb_highprior |> make_list_species_display()

```

## Scenario 1: ANB priority species (animals)

-   Larger groups for scope distribution
    -   Group 1
        -   2 terrestrial mammals (Aziatische grondeekhoorn, Chinese muntjak)
        -   Visual surveys, camera traps
        -   1 tertiary mammal (Wasbeer) as potential free rider
    -   Group 2
        -   3 (partly) freshwater species (Afrikaanse klauwkikker, Beverrat, Muskusrat)
        -   Aquatic eDNA
        -   1 secondary crayfish as free rider

::: notes

- Maar wel focus op beheer en we zien deze goepen dan nog eens terugkomen onder scenario 3,
  - waar ze hun kans krijgen

:::

## Scenario 1: ANB priority species (animals)

-   Smaller groups for remaining scopes
    -   Scopes abundance, abundance under management, e.g.,
        -   Chinese muntjak & Wasbeer (free rider) via visual surveys, camera traps
        -   Chinese muntjak & Afrikaanse klauwkikker via visual surveys, passive acoustic monitoring
    -   Scope distribution under management
        -   Beverrat & Wasbeer (free rider) via visual surveys, camera traps
- We suggest to analyse for Chinese muntjak & Afrikaanse klauwkikker how the scope abundance under management could be filled in

::: notes
